job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are looking for a Senior DevSecOps Engineer who will lead our cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition into a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role is responsible for strengthening 2Base’s security posture, modernizing our pipelines, and guiding the team towards a secure-by-design culture. You will work closely with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure that our systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, perform vulnerability scans, coordinate penetration testing activities, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect, maintain, and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote and uphold a strong “Security First” culture across engineering, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Continuously monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop, own, and mature Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and other automation frameworks.
  • Design and lead secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP to support scalable and compliant deployments.
  • Build, operate, and secure containerized environments using Docker and Kubernetes with enforced security baselines.
  • Implement and maintain secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and application layers.
  • Improve and optimize system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across all critical workloads.
  • Mentor, guide, and upskill DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, decision-making, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate closely with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to ensure security, performance, and delivery objectives align with organisational goals.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions.
  • Strong expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with a focus on secure architecture.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code using Terraform, Ansible, or similar tools.
  • Experience securing and managing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong understanding of networking technologies: LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers.
  • Knowledge of security frameworks and standards (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring and logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM solutions).
  • Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to influence engineering teams.

Preferred Qualifications (Good to Have)

  • Diploma / Degree / B.Tech in IT, CS, MCA
  • Experience in SOC operations or exposure to SIEM and SOAR tools.
  • Relevant certifications such as:
  • AWS Security / DevOps Engineer – Professional
  • Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist (CKS)
  • CEH, CompTIA Security+, or equivalent.

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity and infrastructure automation. Responsibilities include enhancing security posture, modernizing pipelines, and fostering a secure-by-design culture.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Seeking a Senior Business Analyst with 4+ years of experience to lead requirement workshops and translate business needs into functional logic. Must possess strong analytical skills and collaborate effectively with development teams.

job_description:
Graphic Designer

We are looking for a highly creative, self-driven Graphic Designer who can take full ownership of ideation and visual execution. The ideal candidate is someone who not only designs but also thinks creatively, proposes fresh ideas, and transforms concepts into compelling visual experiences, without requiring constant direction.

You will collaborate closely with our Marketing, Creative, and Development teams to build strong brand experiences across digital and print media. A willingness to experiment, learn new tools, and adopt AI-enhanced creative workflows is expected.

Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize and produce visually compelling assets, including marketing materials, presentation decks, brand collateral, web and digital banners, posters, advertisements, and social media content.
  • Independently generate creative ideas, visual concepts, and mood boards aligned with campaign messaging and business goals.
  • Utilize traditional design tools (Adobe Creative Suite) alongside modern AI-powered platforms (e.g., Adobe Firefly, Midjourney, Freepik AI, DALL-E, Shutterstock AI) to enhance speed, creativity, and productivity.
  • Adapt and refine AI-generated assets to maintain originality, brand consistency, legal compliance, and creative integrity.
  • Ensure all visual outputs adhere to brand guidelines, layout principles, typography standards, and quality expectations.
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously while prioritizing deadlines and maintaining accuracy, consistency, and quality.
  • Incorporate feedback with a positive, ownership-driven attitude and continuously improve designs based on performance insights.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Product, Development) to deliver visuals aligned with messaging, UX, and campaign strategies.
  • Stay updated with industry design standards, AI design trends, digital storytelling approaches, and new creative tools.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, Visual Communication, or related field.
  • Proven experience in graphic design with a strong portfolio demonstrating originality, creativity, and design proficiency (mandatory).
  • Expert-level proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign, and working familiarity with tools like Premiere Pro, After Effects, or Figma.
  • Experience or openness to working with AI-assisted design tools (Adobe Firefly, Midjourney, Canva AI, Freepik AI, Stable Diffusion, etc.).
  • Familiarity with design automation workflows such as smart resizing, templates, asset reuse, and variable content design.
  • Understanding of HTML & CSS is an advantage.
  • Strong sense of color theory, composition, visual hierarchy, and typography.
  • Ability to communicate design rationale clearly and confidently present creative decisions.
  • A proactive mindset with the ability to work independently, take initiative, and deliver results with minimal supervision.

He/She must be:

  1. Creative thinker, not just an executor
  2. Ownership-driven, proactive, and self-motivated
  3. Curious about trends, AI advancements, and new design possibilities
  4. Understands design as a balance between aesthetics, message, and business impact.

Experience: 1-2 years of experience

Benefits

A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Creative Graphic Designer needed for ideation and visual execution across digital/print. Must be self-driven, proficient in Adobe Suite, and open to AI design tools. Experience: 1-2 years.

Senior Java Architect

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Closing Date: 12, Dec 2025 Job Published: 06, Dec 2025

Brief Description

We are looking for candidates with 10+ years of experience for this role.

Job Description

The Senior Java Architect is responsible for designing, developing, and overseeing the architecture of enterprise-level Java applications. This role ensures that systems are scalable, high-performing, and secure by leveraging modern Java frameworks and best practices. The Java Architect will collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate various technologies (such as messaging, caching, databases, API gateways, security infrastructures, workflow engines, deployment mechanisms etc.) into a cohesive solution and guide developers in implementing robust, maintainable code.

Core Responsibilities

  • Define the overall architecture for Java-based applications, including the use of microservices, APIs, and integration patterns to meet business requirements.
  • Select and govern the use of Java frameworks (for example, Spring Boot, Spring Security, Hibernate/JPA) to ensure consistency and quality across projects.
  • Lead the end-to-end modernization of a mission-critical on-premises platform, ensuring near zero data loss and minimal downtime during migration.
  • Design and deliver solutions that can run alongside existing systems, support phased rollout across multiple data centres and a DR site, meet strict uptime and performance SLAs, and align with existing monitoring and integration mechanisms.
  • Collaborate with Database and Infrastructure teams to define how applications interact with databases and run in containerized environments (for example, Oracle Database for OLTP and Redis for caching).
  • Establish coding standards, conduct code reviews, and mentor development teams on best practices for error handling, logging, and secure coding.

Responsibilities (Should Have)

  • Design integration solutions using enterprise messaging and API management tools (for example, implementing event streaming with Apache Kafka and using API gateways such as IBM API Connect for external integrations).
  • Work closely with DevOps teams to integrate build and deployment pipelines (for example, Azure DevOps or Jenkins) and containerization platforms (such as Docker and OpenShift) into the development lifecycle.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot the architecture during development and testing, and address performance bottlenecks or security vulnerabilities using monitoring tools, logs, and APM solutions.

Technical Skills (Must Have)

  • Expert-level proficiency in Java (Java SE/EE, ideally including recent versions) and in-depth knowledge of the Java ecosystem.
  • Strong experience with Java frameworks and libraries: Spring Boot for microservices, Spring Security for authentication and authorization, Hibernate/JPA for ORM, and related tools.
  • Hands-on experience designing and implementing microservices architectures and RESTful APIs, including inter-service communication patterns and API documentation (OpenAPI/Swagger).
  • Solid understanding of relational databases, especially Oracle database design and SQL.
  • Strong understanding of API security and authentication/authorization mechanisms (for example, OAuth2, OpenID Connect, JWT).

Technical Skills (Should Have)

  • Knowledge of messaging and streaming platforms like Apache Kafka to support event-driven architecture.
  • Experience with caching and session management solutions (for example, Redis or in-memory grids) to improve performance and scalability.
  • Experience with API gateway products (such as IBM API Connect) for managing internal and external APIs.
  • Proficiency with DevOps and deployment tooling: Git for source control, CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps Pipelines or Jenkins), Docker for containerization, and Kubernetes/OpenShift for orchestration.
  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging frameworks and tools (for example, Elastic Stack/ELK for log aggregation and APM tools like Dynatrace) to ensure the health and performance of Java applications in production.

Technical Skills (Nice to Have)

  • Exposure to NoSQL or multi-model databases and the ability to choose the appropriate data storage technology for specific use cases.
  • Experience with reactive frameworks or newer JDK features that can improve responsiveness and scalability.
  • Broader experience with different API gateways, logging stacks, and APM tools beyond those explicitly mentioned.

Experience and Soft Skills (Must Have)

  • 10+ years of experience in software development with at least 2–3 years in an architect role focused on Java applications.
  • Proven track record in designing and delivering large-scale, distributed systems and enterprise applications using Java technologies.
  • Strong leadership in guiding development teams, conducting design reviews, and driving architectural governance.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to stakeholders and produce clear architectural documentation and diagrams.

Experience (Should Have)

  • Experience optimizing application performance, including profiling Java applications, tuning garbage collection, and applying caching strategies to achieve high throughput and low latency.
  • Prior involvement in secure software development practices, including integrating static code analysis or vulnerability scanning into the development process, and familiarity with DevSecOps concepts.

Important Notice

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Fraud Alert: Please be advised that some fraudsters are promising jobs with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. No payment is ever sought for jobs at Reflections. We contact candidates only through our official website or LinkedIn, and all employment-related emails are sent through the official HR email ID. Please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarification or alerts on this subject.
summary: Seeking a Senior Java Architect with 10+ years of experience to design and oversee enterprise Java application architecture. Responsibilities include leading modernization efforts and ensuring scalable, secure, and high-performing systems.

Introduction

We are seeking candidates with 10+ years of experience for the Senior Front-End Architect role.

Core Responsibilities

  • Define the overall architecture and standards for front-end applications, including framework selection, component design, state management patterns, and integration with backend APIs and real-time services.
  • Lead the modernization of legacy front-end applications (e.g., Adobe Flex and older web UIs) into modern, component-based SPAs built with Angular or React, ensuring minimal disruption to ongoing operations.
  • Design and deliver front-end solutions that can run alongside existing legacy UIs during transition, support phased rollouts across multiple environments and data centres, and meet strict performance and availability requirements.
  • Architect reusable UI components, layout systems, and design patterns that support complex, data-rich screens such as grids, dashboards, real-time views, and map-based visualizations.
  • Collaborate closely with backend, integration, and GIS teams to define API contracts, data models, and mapping integrations (including ESRI or similar map libraries) that are reliable and efficient for front-end consumption.
  • Ensure front-end applications are built with strong security practices, including secure handling of authentication/authorization tokens, input validation, output encoding, and protection against common web vulnerabilities.
  • Establish coding standards, UI architecture guidelines, and best practices for component design, state management, error handling, logging, testing, and performance optimization.
  • Conduct design and code reviews for front-end solutions and provide mentoring and guidance to development teams to ensure consistency and quality.
  • Work with DevOps and infrastructure teams to define how front-end applications are built, packaged, configured per environment, and deployed using CI/CD pipelines.
  • Collaborate with UX and product teams to balance usability, visual design, performance, and technical feasibility, ensuring that architectural choices support current and future UX needs.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot front-end performance and stability using browser developer tools and monitoring platforms, and proactively address issues related to rendering, memory usage, network performance, and JavaScript execution.

Technical Skills (MUST HAVE)

  • Expert-level proficiency in modern JavaScript/TypeScript and deep understanding of browser fundamentals (DOM, rendering pipeline, event loop, performance profiling, security constraints).
  • Strong hands-on experience with at least one major SPA framework (Angular or React) and its ecosystem (routing, forms, state management, testing).
  • Solid experience architecting large-scale, modular front-end applications, including component-based design, reusable UI libraries, and shared design systems.
  • Experience in modernizing legacy UIs (e.g., from Flex/older web stacks) to SPA frameworks, including strategies for co-existence and phased migration.
  • Strong understanding of integrating front-end applications with RESTful APIs and real-time communication mechanisms (e.g., WebSockets, SignalR, Server-Sent Events), including resilience and error handling patterns.
  • Hands-on experience with front-end build and tooling ecosystems (e.g., Webpack, Vite, Angular CLI, npm/yarn, linting, unit testing, end-to-end testing).
  • Good understanding of front-end security fundamentals, including authentication flows, token handling, CSRF, XSS, and content security considerations.
  • Experience with responsive design and cross-browser compatibility to ensure consistent behaviour across devices, resolutions, and browsers.

Technical Skills (SHOULD HAVE)

  • Experience with front-end performance optimization techniques such as bundle analysis, code splitting, lazy loading, caching strategies, minimizing network round trips, and optimizing rendering for data-heavy screens.
  • Familiarity with integrating mapping libraries and GIS components (e.g., ESRI JavaScript API or similar) into web applications to display layers, markers, and real-time updates.
  • Working knowledge of accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG) and practices for building accessible UIs, including ARIA usage, keyboard navigation, and semantic HTML.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD practices for front-end applications, including automated builds, testing, quality gates, and environment-based deployments.

Technical Skills (NICE TO HAVE)

  • Exposure to other front-end frameworks or libraries (e.g., Vue, Svelte, or micro-frontend architectures) and the ability to choose the right approach per context.
  • Experience with design systems or component libraries (e.g., Material, Bootstrap, or custom design systems) and tools such as Storybook for UI documentation and collaboration.
  • Familiarity with analytics and user behaviour tracking tools (e.g., application insights, web analytics) to inform UX and performance improvements.

Experience and Soft Skills (MUST HAVE)

  • 10+ years of experience in front-end or full-stack development, with at least 3-4 years in a lead or architect role focusing on modern web applications.
  • Proven experience designing and delivering complex, data-intensive or real-time front-end applications in mission-critical or high-availability environments.
  • Strong leadership abilities to guide front-end engineers, lead design and code reviews, and drive architectural decisions.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with product, UX, backend, GIS, DevOps, and security teams, and to clearly articulate front-end architecture decisions to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Experience (SHOULD HAVE)

  • Prior involvement in modernization projects where legacy front ends were migrated to Angular or React while maintaining business continuity.
  • Experience working in environments with multiple data centres, strict SLAs, and stringent security and compliance requirements.

job_description:
GIS Architect

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Job Published: 06, Dec 2025 Closing Date: 12, Dec 2025

Introduction

Reflections Info Systems is seeking a highly experienced GIS Architect with over 10 years of experience to design and govern the geospatial architecture for a large, mission-critical enterprise platform. This platform heavily relies on mapping, location intelligence, and real-time spatial data.

Core Responsibilities

  • Define the overall GIS architecture, including ArcGIS Enterprise components, geodatabases, map/feature services, and real-time GIS services, ensuring scalability, high availability, and security across multiple data centres and a DR site.
  • Lead the modernization of legacy GIS implementations into a modern ArcGIS Enterprise–based landscape, including rationalizing map services, refactoring geodatabases, and standardizing service publishing and consumption patterns.
  • Design and govern GIS services used by web, desktop, mobile, and control-room applications, ensuring consistent APIs, performance, and cartographic standards across incident management, resource tracking, analytics, and reporting.
  • Collaborate closely with application, integration, and backend architects to define how GIS services are consumed by business modules (e.g., call taking, dispatch, resource management) and to ensure optimal data flows between GIS and transactional systems.
  • Define standards for spatial data modelling, including base maps, operational layers, network datasets, address data, and other reference layers needed for routing, proximity analysis, and spatial queries.
  • Ensure that GIS components and data are designed to support active-active data centres and DR, including replication strategies, synchronization, and failover behaviour.
  • Work with infrastructure and database teams to define and optimize the hosting environment for GIS servers, data stores, and geodatabases (e.g., ArcGIS Enterprise + Oracle), including capacity planning and performance tuning.
  • Establish best practices for GIS security, including user and role management, service-level permissions, data access policies, and integration with enterprise identity providers.
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to GIS developers, analysts, and administrators, reviewing designs and implementations to ensure alignment with the target GIS architecture.
  • Define and maintain standards for GIS data governance, including data lifecycle, versioning, editing workflows, quality checks, and publication processes.
  • Collaborate with reporting and analytics teams to provide GIS-enabled analytics, dashboards, and spatial insights that support operations and management decision-making.
  • Contribute to capacity planning and performance testing activities, ensuring that GIS components meet response-time and throughput requirements for high-load scenarios.
  • Participate in incident reviews and root cause analysis for GIS-related issues, identifying improvements to architecture, configuration, or operational processes.
  • Support the definition of backup, restore, and archival strategies for GIS data and services in alignment with enterprise RPO/RTO objectives.

Technical Skills

MUST HAVE:

  • Strong hands-on experience with ArcGIS Enterprise (e.g., Portal for ArcGIS, ArcGIS Server, ArcGIS Data Store) in on-premises, multi-server or multi-data-centre deployments.
  • Solid experience with ArcGIS Pro or equivalent desktop tools for managing geodatabases, authoring maps, publishing services, and performing advanced spatial analysis.
  • Deep understanding of enterprise geodatabases (e.g., ArcGIS with Oracle), including schema design, indexing, spatial types, and performance tuning for spatial queries.
  • Knowledge of publishing and managing map services, feature services, geoprocessing services, and network analysis services for high-volume, real-time operational use.
  • Experience designing and implementing GIS solutions for routing, nearest resource identification, geocoding, reverse geocoding, and other spatial operations required by operational systems.
  • Familiarity with integrating GIS services into web and mobile applications via REST APIs, JavaScript APIs, and other client SDKs.
  • Understanding of GIS performance optimization, including service caching, scale settings, layer optimization, and map design for high-density, real-time use.
  • Good understanding of security concepts in GIS platforms, including authentication, authorization, SSL/TLS, and integration with enterprise identity providers.

SHOULD HAVE:

  • Experience with real-time or near real-time GIS components (e.g., GeoEvent Server or equivalent) for streaming data such as vehicle locations, sensors, or event feeds.
  • Familiarity with scripting and automation (e.g., Python, ArcPy, or PowerShell) for GIS administration, data processing, and bulk operations.
  • Working knowledge of integrating GIS with message buses or event streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka, ActiveMQ) to support real-time workflows.
  • Understanding of load balancing and clustering for GIS servers, and how they interact with web tiers and application gateways.

NICE TO HAVE:

job_description:
DevOps Architect

Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd

Location: Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Closing Date: December 12, 2025 Job Published: December 06, 2025

Brief Description

We are seeking candidates with 8+ years of experience for the role of DevOps Architect.

Description

The DevOps Architect is responsible for defining and driving the end-to-end DevOps strategy, tooling, and practices for mission-critical, on-premises and hybrid applications. This role designs and oversees CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code, environment strategy, and observability to ensure that applications are built, tested, released, and operated in a reliable, secure, and repeatable manner across multiple data centres and DR sites. The DevOps Architect works closely with application, infrastructure, security, and operations teams to enable seamless modernization of legacy systems into containerized and microservices-based architectures, while maintaining strict uptime, performance, and compliance requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Define the overall DevOps architecture, standards, and practices for building, testing, releasing, and operating applications across multiple on-premises environments.
  • Design and implement CI/CD pipelines (for example, using Azure DevOps or Jenkins) for Java, .NET, front-end, GIS, database systems and integration services, ensuring automated build, test, security scanning, and deployment.
  • Lead the DevOps enablement for modernization of legacy applications into microservices and containerized workloads, ensuring coexistence with existing monolithic and legacy stacks during the transition.
  • Design deployment strategies (for example, blue-green, canary, rolling updates) suitable for mission-critical, 24×7 systems running in multi-datacenter and DR setups with strict SLAs.
  • Define and implement infrastructure-as-code (IaC) standards (for example, Terraform, Ansible) for provisioning and managing infrastructure, middleware, Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters, and shared services in a consistent, repeatable way.
  • Collaborate closely with Application, Integration, Database, Infrastructure, Security, and Network teams to ensure that pipelines, deployment patterns, and operational processes align with existing on-prem standards, DR strategies, and compliance requirements.
  • Establish and enforce configuration management practices (for example, environment-specific configurations, secrets management, feature flags) across all environments.
  • Define and implement logging, monitoring, and alerting standards (for example, ELK/EFK, Prometheus, Grafana, APM tools) to ensure observability of applications, services, and infrastructure.
  • Drive adoption of DevSecOps practices by integrating security checks (SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, container scanning) into CI/CD pipelines and release processes.
  • Define environment strategy and naming conventions and ensure consistent topology, tagging, and baseline configurations across multiple environments.
  • Implement automated quality gates in CI/CD pipelines, including unit tests, integration tests, security checks, code coverage, and policy compliance checks.
  • Work with Security teams to align DevSecOps practices with organizational policies and compliance requirements, including auditability and evidence collection for releases.
  • Drive continuous improvement of build and deployment times, pipeline reliability, and overall development productivity.
  • Contribute to and review operational runbooks, incident response procedures, and DR playbooks from a DevOps and automation perspective.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills:

  • Strong hands-on experience with CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps Pipelines, Jenkins, or GitLab CI for automating build, test, and deployment workflows.
  • Proficiency with source control and branching strategies (for example, GitFlow, trunk-based development) and integration with work item/issue tracking.
  • Solid experience with containerization and orchestration using Docker and Kubernetes/OpenShift in on-premises or hybrid environments.
  • Practical knowledge of infrastructure-as-code tools (for example, Terraform, Ansible) for provisioning and configuring compute, storage, networking, and platform services.
  • Strong understanding of Linux-based environments, shell scripting, and automation for application and infrastructure operations.
  • Experience with centralized logging and monitoring stacks (for example, Elastic Stack/ELK/EFK, Prometheus, Grafana) and APM tools (for example, Dynatrace, AppDynamics, New Relic).
  • Good understanding of networking fundamentals relevant to DevOps (for example, load balancers, ingress controllers, DNS, certificates, firewall rules, service mesh concepts).
  • Experience integrating artifact repositories (for example, Nexus, Artifactory, Azure Artifacts) with CI/CD pipelines to manage build outputs and dependencies.
  • Familiarity with service mesh or advanced traffic management concepts (for example, Istio, Linkerd, API gateways) as part of blue-green/canary deployment strategies.
  • Working knowledge of security tools and scanners (for example, SonarQube, OWASP ZAP, Snyk, Trivy, Aqua, or similar) integrated with CI/CD.
  • Knowledge of scripting/programming languages used for automation (for example, Bash, PowerShell, Python, or Groovy).

Secondary Technical Skills and Experience:

  • Exposure to cloud platforms (for example, Azure, AWS) and hybrid DevOps patterns (on-prem plus cloud) even if current deployment is primarily on-premises.
  • Experience with GitOps approaches using tools like Argo CD or Flux for Kubernetes-based deployments.
  • Familiarity with SRE practices (for example, error budgets, SLOs/SLIs, reliability engineering) and how they tie into monitoring and alerting design.
  • Experience with secrets management tools (for example, HashiCorp Vault, Key Management Services) and policy-as-code tools (for example, Open Policy Agent, Azure Policy).

Experience and Soft Skills:

  • 8+ years of experience in DevOps, build and release engineering, or infrastructure engineering, with at least 3–4 years in a lead/architect role.
  • Proven experience implementing DevOps practices for large-scale, distributed, mission-critical systems with strict uptime and performance SLAs.
  • Experience working in environments with multiple data centres and DR sites, including supporting failover, recovery testing, and environment synchronization.
  • Prior involvement in modernization projects where legacy applications were incrementally migrated to microservices and containers while maintaining business continuity.
  • Experience coordinating releases across multiple teams and systems, including change management and release governance in regulated or high-security environments.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with architects, developers, testers, infrastructure, security, and operations teams.
  • Ability to document DevOps architectures, pipelines, standards, and operational runbooks clearly and consistently.

Important Information for Jobseekers

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

For any clarification or to report suspicious activity, please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com.

job_description:
Security Architect

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd

Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581

Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com

Closing Date: 12, Dec 2025

Job Published: 06, Dec 2025

Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Description

The Security Architect is responsible for defining and governing the security architecture for mission-critical, on-premises enterprise platforms running across multiple data centres and a dedicated disaster recovery site. This role designs and reviews security controls across applications, integrations, data, infrastructure, and identities to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The Security Architect works closely with application, integration, infrastructure, network, and DevOps teams to embed security into the modernization of legacy systems into microservices and containerized workloads, while meeting strict regulatory, audit, and compliance requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Define the overall security architecture and reference patterns for applications, APIs, integrations, and data flows across multiple on-premises environments and data centres.
  • Establish and maintain security standards for identity and access management (e.g., SSO, MFA, RBAC), network security (segmentation, firewalls, VPNs), and endpoint protection in alignment with enterprise policies.
  • Work closely with Application, Integration, and API teams to ensure secure design of microservices, web applications, mobile/MDT clients, and external-facing APIs (including authentication, authorization, input validation, and secure session handling).
  • Collaborate with Infrastructure and Network teams to ensure secure configurations of servers, containers, Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters, databases, load balancers, and WAFs in on-prem data centres and DR sites.
  • Define and review security controls for integrations with external systems (e.g., government systems, third-party services), including secure connectivity, data protection in transit and at rest, and endpoint hardening.
  • Oversee the implementation of logging, monitoring, and alerting for security events, working with SIEM/SOC teams to ensure effective detection, correlation, and response to threats.
  • Drive secure SDLC and DevSecOps practices by embedding security requirements, threat modelling, and security testing (SAST, DAST, dependency and container scanning) into development and CI/CD pipelines.
  • Conduct architecture and design reviews for new solutions and change requests, identifying risks and recommending mitigations to ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements.
  • Define and maintain security baselines, hardening guides, and configuration benchmarks for platforms, middleware, and databases used in the environment.
  • Lead or contribute to threat modelling exercises and risk assessments for key applications, integrations, and infrastructure components, and ensure that findings are translated into actionable controls.
  • Define and review policies for secure access to environments (e.g., privileged access, just-in-time access, break-glass accounts) in collaboration with Infrastructure and Operations teams.
  • Support incident response and forensic analysis activities by ensuring appropriate logging, evidence collection, and coordination with SOC or security operations teams.
  • Contribute to business continuity and disaster recovery planning from a security perspective, ensuring that DR strategies maintain required security controls and data protection.
  • Provide security guidance and coaching to architects, developers, DevOps engineers, and operations teams, promoting a security-by-design and security-by-default culture.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills:

  • Strong understanding of security architecture principles for enterprise applications, APIs, microservices, and integrations in on-premises and hybrid environments.
  • Hands-on knowledge of identity and access management concepts and technologies, such as Active Directory/LDAP, SSO, MFA, RBAC, OAuth2, OpenID Connect, and JWT-based authentication.
  • Good understanding of application security fundamentals, including OWASP Top 10, secure coding practices, input validation, output encoding, and secure session/token management.
  • Experience working with network security controls, including firewalls, VPNs, reverse proxies, WAFs, network zoning, and secure remote access patterns.
  • Familiarity with securing containerized workloads and orchestration platforms (e.g., Docker and Kubernetes/OpenShift), including image scanning, runtime security, and secure configuration of clusters.
  • Knowledge of database and data security, including encryption at rest and in transit, database hardening, least privilege, and secure access patterns for Oracle and other relational databases.
  • Experience with security logging and monitoring, SIEM platforms, and integration of application and infrastructure logs into centralized monitoring for security analytics.
  • Experience integrating security tools and scanners into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, container image scanning) and interpreting results for remediation.
  • Familiarity with secrets management tools and practices (e.g., secure storage of keys, certificates, tokens, and passwords; rotation and lifecycle management).
  • Knowledge of endpoint and server hardening practices and baseline frameworks (e.g., CIS benchmarks or equivalent).
  • Working knowledge of encryption technologies (e.g., TLS, certificates, key management) and their application to APIs, services, and data stores.

Experience and Soft Skills:

  • 10+ years of experience in information security, application security, or infrastructure security, with at least 3-4 years in a security architect or equivalent role.
  • Proven experience designing or reviewing security architectures for large-scale, mission-critical systems with strict uptime, performance, and compliance requirements.
  • Experience working in multi-datacentre and DR-enabled environments, including understanding of security implications of failover, replication, and high availability.
  • Strong ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams (application, infrastructure, DevOps, network, operations) and influence secure design decisions.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate risks, options, and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Prior involvement in modernization projects where legacy applications and integrations were migrated to more modern architectures while maintaining or improving security posture.
  • Experience in environments subject to regulatory, audit, or compliance requirements (e.g., ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS, or similar), with familiarity in preparing or supporting audits.

Secondary Skills:

Technical Skills and Experience:

  • Exposure to zero-trust architecture concepts and their practical application in on-prem or hybrid environments.
  • Experience with policy-as-code and security-as-code approaches (e.g., using tools such as Open Policy Agent) for enforcing security controls consistently.
  • Familiarity with SRE and observability concepts (e.g., SLIs/SLOs, error budgets) and how security ties into reliability and operational dashboards.
  • Experience with data classification, data loss prevention (DLP), and privacy-by-design principles.

Certifications:

  • Security certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or SABSA that demonstrate strong security architecture or governance knowledge.
  • Technical security certifications such as Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), GIAC (e.g., GCSA, GWEB), or vendor-specific security certifications.
  • Any formal training or certification in secure software development, DevSecOps, or application security testing.

Contact Information:

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Important Note: Please be aware of potential fraudsters. Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd never asks for payment for job applications. Official communication is through the company website or LinkedIn, and all employment emails originate from the official HR email ID. Contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarifications or alerts regarding this matter.

job_description:
Test Architect

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Closing Date: December 12, 2025 Job Published: December 05, 2025 Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Brief Description

We are looking for candidates with 8+ years of experience for this role.

Description

The Test Architect is responsible for defining and governing the overall testing strategy, frameworks, and practices for mission-critical enterprise platforms running across multiple on-premises data centres and a DR site. This role ensures that functional, integration, regression, performance, security, GIS, and DR testing are designed and executed in a consistent, automated, and repeatable way across legacy and modernized components. The Test Architect works closely with application, integration, GIS, infrastructure, DevOps, and security teams to enable high-quality releases as the platform transitions from monolithic and legacy stacks to microservices, modern web UIs, and containerized workloads.

Responsibilities

  • Define the end-to-end test strategy and test architecture for a large, mission-critical platform, covering functional, integration, regression, system, UAT support, and non-functional testing (performance, reliability, security, usability).
  • Design a comprehensive test approach that supports coexistence of legacy and modernized components (web, desktop, mobile/MDT, APIs, GIS services), ensuring regression coverage across phased rollouts and multiple data centres/DR.
  • Establish and govern test automation frameworks for APIs, UI (web and mobile), and backend services, promoting high levels of automation in CI/CD pipelines.
  • Define test plans and standards for integration testing across modules and external systems (for example, government systems, telephony, GIS, messaging platforms, and databases).
  • Collaborate with DevOps and Infrastructure teams to align test environments, environment configuration, and data refresh strategies with deployment models, including active-active DC and DR.
  • Define non-functional testing strategies (for example, performance, load, stress, soak, failover, and DR testing) and ensure they are executed as part of major releases.
  • Set up and maintain standards for test data management, including anonymization or masking where needed, to ensure realistic and secure test datasets.
  • Provide leadership and guidance to QA and test teams, ensuring consistent application of test processes, tools, and best practices across projects.
  • Define and maintain a test governance model, including entry/exit criteria, defect severity/priority definitions, and release readiness criteria.
  • Collaborate with Security and DevSecOps teams to ensure security testing (for example, SAST/DAST, vulnerability scanning) is included in the overall test strategy and pipeline.
  • Support UAT and business testing by providing guidance on test scenarios, acceptance criteria, and tools for user-facing validation.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement of testing practices, tools, and metrics, using data-driven insights to enhance quality and speed of delivery.
  • Participate in incident reviews and post-release retrospectives to identify testing gaps and update strategies accordingly.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills:

  • Strong experience designing and implementing test automation frameworks for web UIs (e.g., Selenium, Playwright, Cypress), APIs (e.g., REST-assured, Postman/Newman, Karate), and backend services.
  • Solid understanding of testing strategies for microservices and distributed systems, including contract testing, integration testing, and end-to-end scenario testing.
  • Experience with performance and load testing tools (e.g., JMeter, Gatling, Locust) to validate throughput, latency, and resource utilization under realistic and peak loads.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab CI) and integrating automated tests into pipelines as quality gates.
  • Understanding of testing in complex, on-premises environments involving multiple application tiers, GIS services (e.g., ArcGIS), databases (e.g., Oracle), and message buses/streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka).
  • Knowledge of test management tools (e.g., Azure Test Plans, JIRA/Xray, Zephyr, or similar) for planning, execution, and traceability.
  • Good understanding of software quality principles, risk-based testing, and test design techniques (e.g., boundary value analysis, equivalence partitioning, combinatorial testing).
  • Experience with service virtualization and mocking tools to simulate unavailable or third-party systems during integration testing.
  • Familiarity with test automation for desktop or rich-client applications where relevant.
  • Understanding of observability and logging tools (e.g., ELK/EFK, APM solutions) for testing, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis.
  • Knowledge of testing strategies for GIS applications (e.g., validating map layers, geocoding accuracy, routing results, and real-time location updates).

Experience and Soft Skills:

  • 8+ years of experience in software testing and quality engineering, with at least 3-4 years in a Test Architect or equivalent senior QA leadership role.
  • Proven experience defining and implementing test strategies for large-scale, mission-critical systems with strict uptime and performance SLAs.
  • Experience working in environments with multiple data centres and DR, including participation in failover and DR testing exercises.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work with architects, developers, DevOps, GIS, infrastructure, and business stakeholders.
  • Ability to document test strategies, test architectures, standards, and procedures clearly and concisely.

Experience:

  • Prior involvement in modernization projects where legacy applications and UIs were gradually replaced with microservices and modern web front ends, with sustained test coverage across the transition.
  • Experience working in regulated or high-compliance environments, ensuring traceability of requirements to test cases, results, and defects for audit purposes.

Secondary Skills:

Technical Skills and Experience:

  • Exposure to SRE and reliability engineering concepts (e.g., SLOs, SLIs, error budgets) and how testing can support reliability goals.
  • Experience with chaos engineering or resilience testing tools and practices.
  • Familiarity with model-based testing, property-based testing, or other advanced testing techniques.
  • Knowledge of test data generation tools and synthetic data strategies.

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Important Notice:

This is to notify jobseekers that some fraudsters are promising jobs with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. Please note that no payment is ever sought for jobs in Reflections. We contact our candidates only through our official website or LinkedIn and all employment related mails are sent through the official HR email id. Please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarification/alerts on this subject.
summary: Seeking an 8+ years experienced Test Architect to define testing strategies for mission-critical platforms. Responsibilities include automation framework design and collaboration with development teams.

job_description:
Senior Software Engineer – Embedded

Company: TRENSER Technology Solutions (P) Ltd Location: Thejaswini, 2nd floor, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.trenser.com Contact Email: careers@trenser.com Job Published: 04, Dec 2025 Closing Date: 20, Dec 2025

Overview

This position is for a Senior Software Engineer responsible for developing embedded firmware and applications for a long-term client. The job location is Trivandrum, India. The engineer will work along with the existing project team for technical and management aspects. Work involves requirement elicitation, software component designing, and implementation. The engineer will be responsible for taking each assigned task to completion, ensuring the quality of deliverables. The role requires self-initiative, decision-making, and self-directing capabilities to work with minimal supervision and a “can-do” attitude.

Job Responsibilities

  • Perform software requirements analysis and determine the functional and non-functional requirements of the project.
  • Write production-quality code and perform developer testing.
  • Communicate with clarity of requirements and expectations of deliverables.
  • Ensure on-time completion of assigned tasks, ensuring code quality.
  • Work closely with stakeholders, including customers, to ensure project success.
  • Manage priority changes and conflicts gracefully with stakeholders involved.
  • Address customer escalations and be able to think at a fast pace to identify and solve issues in the product.
  • Stay up to date on relevant technology and process advancements.

Qualifications and Requirements

  • More than 5 years of experience in the development of firmware, drivers, middleware, and applications in Embedded Linux/ RTOS.
  • Proficient in Embedded C.
  • Sound knowledge of Embedded Linux/ RTOS internals.
  • Good understanding of software development lifecycles (SDLC), version control tools.
  • Experience in developing software under Waterfall and Agile development methodology.
  • Knowledgeable and well-versed with various development tools for designing, coding, debugging/troubleshooting, testing, bug tracking, collaboration, and source control.
  • Bachelor’s or Master's in an Engineering discipline.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Outstanding attitude and energy to explore unfamiliar software implementations and troubleshoot issues.
  • Strong interpersonal skills to get things done as a team.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to judge and estimate work volume for given tasks.
  • Ability to manage priority and get things done on time.
  • Self-motivated individual with accountability and responsibility.
summary: Senior Software Engineer developing embedded firmware/applications. Requires 5+ years experience in Embedded Linux/RTOS and Embedded C for client projects. Role involves full SDLC with minimal supervision.

job_description:
Android Architect

Company: TRENSER Technology Solutions (P) Ltd Location: Thejaswini, 2nd floor, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.trenser.com Contact Email: careers@trenser.com Closing Date: December 27, 2025 Job Published: December 04, 2025

Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Android Architect to lead the design and development of scalable, high-quality Android applications. The ideal candidate will be responsible for defining the application architecture, guiding the engineering team, and ensuring the successful delivery of robust Android solutions. This role requires deep technical expertise, strong leadership, and the ability to collaborate effectively across multiple teams.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze business and technical requirements to design scalable, high-performing Android applications from the ground up.
  • Define, document, and enforce Android application architecture and best practices.
  • Develop Proofs of Concept (POCs) for complex or critical technical components.
  • Guide, mentor, and support the development team in following architectural guidelines and coding standards.
  • Collaborate closely with product managers, UI/UX designers, and backend teams to ensure seamless integration and smooth delivery.
  • Participate in design discussions, code reviews, and technical evaluations.
  • Identify risks, propose solutions, and ensure high-quality and timely delivery of features.
  • Continuously explore, evaluate, and adopt new Android technologies, tools, libraries, and design patterns to improve performance, scalability, and developer productivity.

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

Required Skills:

  • 8+ years of experience in Android application development, with strong architectural exposure.
  • Expert-level proficiency in Kotlin and Java.
  • Hands-on experience with Android Jetpack, MVVM/MVI, and dependency injection frameworks (Dagger/Hilt).
  • Solid experience integrating RESTful APIs, third-party SDKs, and backend services.
  • Deep understanding of design patterns, modular architecture, and code optimization techniques.
  • Experience with publishing and maintaining apps on the Google Play Store.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and technical leadership skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities to work across cross-functional teams.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Electronics, or related engineering discipline.
summary: Seeking an Android Architect with 8+ years experience to design scalable apps. Responsibilities include defining architecture, guiding teams, and ensuring quality delivery. Must be proficient in Kotlin/Java.

job_description:

job_description:
Solution Architect - Java & Cloud

Company: TRENSER Technology Solutions (P) Ltd Location: Thejaswini, 2nd floor, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.trenser.com Contact Email: careers@trenser.com Job Published: 04, Dec 2025 Closing Date: 20, Dec 2025

Role Overview:

We are looking for a Solution Architect with strong expertise in Java technologies and Cloud platforms to design, develop, and implement scalable, high-performance solutions. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Spring Boot, microservices architecture, and modern cloud infrastructures. Experience in the Healthcare domain will be a plus.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and architect end-to-end solutions using Java, Spring Boot, and cloud technologies (AWS / Azure / GCP).
  • Define solution architecture, integration patterns, and technical roadmaps aligned with business goals.
  • Collaborate with product owners, developers, and stakeholders to translate business needs into scalable technical solutions.
  • Lead and mentor development teams in implementing architectural best practices.
  • Ensure solutions meet performance, security, and compliance standards.
  • Evaluate and recommend tools, frameworks, and cloud services to optimize development and deployment processes.
  • Conduct architecture and code reviews to maintain technical quality and consistency.
  • Provide technical leadership throughout the project lifecycle.

Preferred Skills:

Required Skills & Experience:

  • 9+ years of hands-on experience in Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and Microservices architecture.
  • Strong understanding of Cloud platforms (AWS / Azure / GCP) – experience in designing and deploying cloud-native solutions.
  • Good knowledge of databases – relational (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle) and NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB).
  • Solid understanding of API design, integration patterns, and DevOps practices (CI/CD, containerization with Docker/Kubernetes).
  • Strong communication, analytical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Ability to document and present architecture designs clearly to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Healthcare domain knowledge – good to have (experience with HL7, FHIR, HIPAA compliance is advantageous).

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with Event-Driven Architecture (Kafka, RabbitMQ).
  • Familiarity with Serverless and Cloud-native design patterns.
  • Exposure to architecture frameworks (TOGAF, Zachman).
  • Certification in AWS / Azure / GCP is a plus.
summary: Seeking a Java and Cloud Solution Architect to design scalable solutions using Spring Boot and microservices. Requires 9+ years experience in Java, cloud platforms, and strong communication skills.

job_description:

You will:

  • Learn and understand project requirements, architecture, and software development practices under the guidance of senior engineers.
  • Participate in real-world web development projects using modern technologies and frameworks.
  • Shadow senior developers to observe best practices in coding, debugging, testing, and deployment.
  • Conduct research and build small proofs-of-concept (PoCs) to explore new technologies or solve specific problems.
  • Collaborate with team members during code reviews, estimation sessions, and technical discussions.
  • Assist in designing, developing, and testing features for web applications following established standards.
  • Learn about REST APIs, front-end and back-end integration, and performance optimisation.
  • Support documentation, reporting, and analysis of assigned tasks and findings.
  • Maintain professionalism, curiosity, and a continuous learning mindset while contributing to team goals.

Preferred Skills

You have:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with good knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and mathematics.
  • Familiarity with at least one programming language: JavaScript, Python, Java, or C++.
  • Basic understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and modern frameworks (React, Node.js, etc.) from academics or self-learning.
  • Understanding of object-oriented programming and database concepts (SQL, relational models).
